Private Types

typedef void * in

Detailed Description

Class used to reconstruct image.

Can read capacitance data from file. Display reconstruction results.

Definition at line 8 of file Reconstructor_2D.m.

Member Typedef Documentation

in  alfa

alg_Landweber calculates one step of Landweber iteration

Parameters:

Ep current estimation of permittivity distribution (previous step) in form of column vector
alfa relaxation factor (step length)
Return values:
Ep (column vector) new better estimation of permittivity

in  alfa,
in  u,
in  constrain,
in  lt,
in  ut 
)

alg_LevenMarq_Limit calculates one step of Levenberg Marquard iteration with constrain for permittivity value, that is not less than 1

Parameters:
S sensitivity matrix
Cr vector of capacitances to be measured for current estimation of Ep
Cm vector of measured capacitances
Ep current estimation of permittivity distribution (previous step) in form of column vector
alfa relaxation factor (step length)
u Thikonov regularization factor for matrix pseudo inverse
constrain 'constrain' to limit permittivity value
lt lower threshold
ut upper threshold
Return values:
Ep (column vector) new better estimation of permittivity

S sensitivity matrix calculated for current solution estimate S(i)

function it_recon ( in  varargin  ) 

it_recon performs general scheme of iterative reconstruction.

Function is overload.

Parameters:
First:varargin{1} disp_mode 'display' or 'no_display' during reconstruction
Second:varargin{1} algorithm params (struct), struct properties are:
Second:varargin{1}:struct:method iterative algorithm method (equation for one step)
Second:varargin{1}:struct:method:name 'LBP' linearized backprojection
Second:varargin{1}:struct:method:name 'Landweber' gradient steepest descent with small step (default)
Second:varargin{1}:struct:method:name 'LandweberNormalized' Landweber for normalized data
Second:varargin{1}:struct:method:name 'NewtonRaphson' nonlinear Gauss-Newton with regularization
Second:varargin{1}:struct:method:name 'NewtonRaphsonConstrained' nonlinear Gauss-Newton with regularization and a constrain
Second:varargin{1}:struct:method:name 'LM' nonlinear Gauss-Newton with Marquardt regularization
Second:varargin{1}:struct:numiter stop after 'numiter' iterations
Second:varargin{1}:struct:stop_delta stop when image changes are lower than 'stop_delta'
Second:varargin{1}:struct:update_method 'modulo' or 'auto' method of selecting moment for sensitivity matrix update
Second:varargin{1}:struct:iter_mod update sensitivity matrix modulo 'iter_mod' iteration
Second:varargin{1}:struct:update_delta update sensitivity where dC becomes lower than 'update_delta'
Second:varargin{1}:struct:alpha relaxation factor (step length)
Second:varargin{1}:struct:alphalimit limitation of relaxation factor: 'adapt or 'noadapt'
Second:varargin{1}:struct:regular 'manual', 'l_curve' or 'GCV' selection of regularization parameter u
Second:varargin{1}:struct:u Thikonov regularization factor for matrix pseudo inverse
Second:varargin{2} disp_mode 'display' or 'no_display' during reconstruction
Return values:
Ep new better estimation of permittivity

Reimplemented from Reconstructor.

function read_data ( in  rec_obj,
in  file_name,
in  M,
in  frame1,
in  frame2 
)

fuction reads measured data from a capacitance tomograph, and set this value to start solution

Parameters:
file_name a name of a file contained measuring data
M number of measurements
frame1 number of frame contained capacitance measurements.
frame2 number of frame contained capacitance measurements.
Return values:
object.C_meas capacitance maeaurements
object.C_min minimal values of capacitances
object.C_max maximal values of capacitances

function recon_qual ( in  rec_obj,
in  Ep_Pha,
in  S_Pha,
in  Cm,
in  Ep_0,
in  S_0,
in  Cr_0,
in  Ep,
in  S,
in  Cr,
in  scale 
)

recon_qual calculates norms for image (permittivity distribution), sensitivity matrix and measurement recon_qual calculates norms for image (permittivity distribution), sensitivity matrix and measurement the discrepancy (normalized square norm) 1.

between numerical phantom or model and reconstructed image 2. between sensitivity matrix for phantom and sensitivity matrix for solution estimate 3. between measured values and reprojected using current solution estimate

Parameters:
Ep_Pha permittivity distribution of numerical phantom or model
S_Pha sensitivity matrix calculated for phantom or model
Cm measurements - real values
Ep_0 permittivity distribution of initial (start) solution Ep(0)
S_0 sensitivity matrix calculated for initial solution Ep(0)
Cr_0 measurements - reprojected values for initial solution Ep(0)
Ep permittivity distribution - current solution estimate Ep(i)
S sensitivity matrix calculated for current solution estimate S(i)
Cr measurements - reprojected values for current solution Ep(i)
scale '2one' to scaling to 1 or 'norm' to normalize
Return values:
Cap_err vector of normalized L2 distance in measurement domain
Imag_err vector of normalized L2 distance in image domain
Sens_err vector of normalized L2 distance between models

function step_length ( in  rec_obj,
in  S,
in  Cr,
in  Cm,
in  Ep,
in  Epp,
in  u 
)

% step_length calculates optimal steps alpha and beta by minimizing |c-Se(i+1| norm for next step e(i+1)=e(i) + a inv(S'(SS'+uI))(c-Se(i))

Parameters:
S sensitivity matrix
Cr vector of capacitances to be measured for current estimation of Ep
Cm vector of measured capacitances
Ep current estimation of permittivity distribution (column vector)
Epp previous estimation of permittivity distribution (column vector)
u Thikonov regularization factor for matrix pseudo inverse
Return values:
alpha,beta optimal step lengths

in  line,
in  marker 
)

out return value of this method
